data.title: These twins were born just 3 minutes apart â€“ but in different years
data.meta_description: Seven Morris was born at 11:59 p.m. on Dec. 31st at a Connecticut hospital. Minutes later, his sister, Souli was born at 12:02 a.m. on Jan. 1.
data.text:
It's not uncommon to hear a twin proclaim how many minutes older they are than their sibling, but for one Connecticut pair, those few minutes meant being born in different years.

Mykel and Aliyah Kiyomi Morris welcomed a baby boy and baby girl just minutes apart at Yale New Haven Hospital.

Seven Morris was born at 11:59 a.m. on Dec. 31, marking the hospital's last recorded birth of 2023, a news release from the health system said.

A few minutes later, at 12:02 a.m. on Jan. 1, his twin sister Souli Morris became the first baby born at the hospital in 2024.

Rare pregnancy: Alabama woman pregnant with 2 babies in 2 uteruses gives birth ahead of Christmas

Both babies are healthy and weighed in at six pound and nine ounces.

"The family is doing great and getting some well-deserved rest," the hospital said in the news release.
